children: A 42-year-old woman is evaluated for a 6-month history of bilateral hand arthritis.
A radiograph of the left hand is
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient has rheumatoid arthritis, as demonstrated by the radiographic findings of symmetric joint-space narrowing, periarticular osteopenia, and erosive changes most prominent in the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints where the synovium inserts on bone.

objective.__html: Recognize the classic radiographic findings of rheumatoid arthritis.
